did.head: Overview of the Collection

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: United Colonies of New England. Commissioners

did.unittitle: Records of the Commissioners of the United Colonies of New England
did.abstract: Minutes, records of acts, letters, etc. of the New England Confederation comprised of Massachusetts Bay, Plymouth, Connecticut, and New Haven.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Massachusetts, Plymouth, Connecticut, and New Haven established a confederation known as the United Colonies of New England. Also known as the New England Confederation, the alliance served to protect its members from Indian attacks, and its commissioners—two from each colony, with six votes needed to approve any decision—met to resolve disputes over trade, boundaries, and religion. The confederation’s decisions and recommendations were advisory rather than mandatory, however, and its influence proved weak until its dissolution when Massachusetts’ charter was revoked in 1684.

Source: "United Colonies of New England established," The Gilder Lehrman Institute of American History, accessed May 9, 2012, http://www.gilderlehrman.org/history-by-era/thirteen-colonies/timeline-terms/united-colonies-new-england-established.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Minutes, records of acts, letters, etc. of the New England Confederation that was comprised of Massachusetts Bay, Plymouth, Connecticut, and New Haven. Volume 53 also includes records of the Court of Assistants, May 11, 1669 - October 7, 1686 and October 1, 1696 - October 3, 1701.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in 2 volumes numbered within the larger collection of Early General Records as volumes 52-53. There are no other volume numbers assigned.

bibref.title: The United Colonies of New England, 1643-90.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Researchers should first consult use copies when available. See Alternate Form Available Section below.

altformavail.head: Alternative Form Available
altformavail.p: Available on microfilm. EGR volumes 52-53 are on Reel LH 4419/20 (LDS 0003667).
Volume 53, Court of Assistants records has been transcribed in .

note.p: Previous finding aids listed EGR Volume 54 as part of the Records of the Commissioners of the United Colonies of New England. However, that volume appears to be records of the Council and is now listed in RG 001:008, Records of the Governor and Council. It is not listed here.

scopecontent.p: Volume in reverse is records of the Court of Assistants, May 11, 1669-October 7, 1686 and October 1, 1696- October 3, 1701.
